info.title: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs
info.description: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

parameters.name: createCallRequest
parameters.description: The create call request.

201.description: Returns details of the call properties once the CreateCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

post.summary: Create an outbound call.
post.description: Create an outbound call.

parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

parameters.name: answerCallRequest
parameters.description: The answer call request.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties once the AnswerCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

post.summary: Answer a Call.
post.description: Answer a call using the IncomingCallContext from Event Grid.

parameters.name: connectRequest
parameters.description: The create connection request.

post.summary: Create a Connection to a CallLocator.
post.description: Create a connection to a CallLocator.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties.

get.summary: Get the detail properties of an ongoing call.

204.description: Call automation service has left the call.

delete.summary: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.
delete.description: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.

parameters.name: transferToParticipantRequest
parameters.description: The transfer to participant request.

202.description: The service has accepted the transfer request and will begin processing it. You will receive either CallTransferAccepted or CallTransferFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Transfer the call to a participant.
post.description: Transfer the call to a participant.

parameters.name: playRequest
parameters.description: play request payload.

202.description: The service has accepted the play request and will begin processing it. You will receive either PlayCompleted or PlayFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Plays audio to participants in the call.
post.description: Plays audio to participants in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the start transcription request and will begin processing it. You will receive either TranscriptionStarted or TranscriptionFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Starts transcription in the call
post.description: Starts transcription in the call

parameters.name: stopTranscriptionRequest
parameters.description: stop transcription request payload.

202.description: The service has accepted the stop transcription request and will begin processing it. You will receive either TranscriptionStopped event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Stops transcription in the call.
post.description: Stops transcription in the call.

parameters.name: updateTranscriptionRequest
parameters.description: The UpdateTranscription request

post.summary: UpdateTranscription Api.
post.description: API to change transcription language.

parameters.name: summarizeCallRequest
parameters.description: The SummarizeCall request

202.description: The service has accepted the summarize call request and will begin processing it. You will receive TranscriptionCallSummaryUpdated event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: API to trigger a summary of the call so far.
post.description: API to trigger a summary of the call so far.

202.description: The service has accepted the cancel request and will begin processing it. You will receive the RecognizeCanceled and/or PlayCanceled event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request, based on which media operation has been canceled by it.

post.summary: Cancel all media operations in a call.
post.description: Cancel all media operations in a call.

parameters.name: recognizeRequest
parameters.description: The media recognize request

202.description: The service has accepted the recognize request and will begin processing it. You will receive either RecognizeCompleted or RecognizeFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Recognize media from call.
post.description: Recognize media from call.

parameters.name: continuousDtmfRecognitionRequest
parameters.description: The continuous recognize request

200.description: The service has started continuous dtmf recognition. You will receive either the ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneReceived, ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneFailed or ContinuousDtmfRecognitionStopped event at your specified callback URI. Continuous dtmf recognition can run in parallel with other media operations. For example if the Recognize operation is also active and a dtmf is detected, both ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneReceived and RecognizeCompleted events will be received.

post.summary: Start continuous Dtmf recognition by subscribing to tones.

parameters.name: continuousDtmfRecognitionRequest
parameters.description: The continuous recognize request

200.description: The service has stopped continuous dtmf recognition. If continuous dtmf recognition was previously started, you will receive the ContinuousDtmfRecognitionStopped event at your specified callback URI.

post.summary: Stop continuous Dtmf recognition by unsubscribing to tones.

parameters.name: sendDtmfTonesRequest

202.description: The service has accepted the send dtmf tones request and will begin processing it. You will receive either the SendDtmfTonesCompleted or the SendDtmfTonesFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

parameters.name: stopMediaStreamingRequest

parameters.description: The request body of start call recording request.

200.description: Returns the start call recording response.

202.description: The service has accepted the StartCallRecording request and will begin processing it. You will receive either a StartRecordingFailed event or RecordingStateChanged event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

204.description: Returns the stop call recording response.

post.summary: Pause recording the call.

post.summary: Resume recording the call.

correlationId.description: Correlation ID for event to call correlation. Also called ChainId for skype chain ID.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

AddParticipantFailed.description: The failed to add participants event.

sourceDisplayName.description:
(Optional) The display name of the source that is associated with this invite operation when
adding a PSTN participant or teams user.  Note: Will not update the display name in the roster.

invitationTimeoutInSeconds.description:
Gets or sets the timeout to wait for the invited participant to pickup.
The maximum value of this is 180 seconds

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

The list of call participants play provided audio to.
Plays to everyone in the call when not provided.

message.description: Message associated with the code for diagnosing.

endSilenceTimeoutInMs.description: The length of end silence when user stops speaking and cogservice send response.

confidence.description: The confidence level of the recognized speech, if available, ranges from 0.0 to 1.0.

ssmlText.description: Ssml string for the cognitive service to be played

recordingStateCallbackUri.description: The uri to send notifications to.

audioChannelParticipantOrdering.description:
The sequential order in which audio channels are assigned to participants in the unmixed recording.
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed' and `audioChannelParticipantOrdering is not specified,
the audio channel to participant mapping will be automatically assigned based on the order in which participant
first audio was detected.  Channel to participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.

channelAffinity.description:
The channel affinity of call recording
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed', if channelAffinity is not specified, 'channel' will be automatically assigned.
Channel-Participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.
///

callTopic.description: A very short description (max 48 chars) of the reason for the call. To be displayed in Teams CallNotification

callContext.description: A summary of the call thus far. It will be displayed on a side panel in the Teams UI

transcriptUrl.description: Url for fetching the transcript of the call

callSentiment.description: Sentiment of the call thus far

suggestedActions.description: Recommendations for resolving the issue based on the customer's intent and interaction history

TeamsPhoneCallDetails.description: The call details which will be sent to the target

isAuthenticated.description: Flag indicating whether the caller was authenticated

additionalCallerInformation.description: A set of key value pairs (max 10, any additional entries would be ignored) which a bot author wants to pass to the Teams Client for display to the agent

TeamsPhoneCallerDetails.description: Container for details relating to the original caller of the call

language.description: Language of the source entity passing along the call details, passed in the ISO-639 standard

status.description: Status of the source entity passing along the call details

intendedTargets.description: Intended targets of the source entity passing along the call details

TeamsPhoneSourceDetails.description: Container for details relating to the entity responsible for the creation of these call details

text.description: Text for the cognitive service to be played
